channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: No 'going back' for Elon Musk after calling for Trump impeachment, says Steve Bannon
item.description: Right-wing podcaster and former Trump adviser Steve Bannon says Elon Musk "crossed the Rubicon" by calling for impeachment. He says the president should deal with feud as "national security issue."

item.title: We asked NPR listeners what they sing to their babies. Hear some of our favorites
item.description: After a new study confirmed singing to babies can help boost their health and happiness, we asked our listeners and readers what they sing to their little ones. Listen to some of our favorites.

item.title: Sen. Tim Kaine says Trump's tariffs could reduce federal debt, but at what cost?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Sen. Tim Kaine, D-Va., who is also on the Senate Budget Committee, about how President Trump's tariffs will affect the federal budget and the economy.

item.title: CBO says Trump's tariffs could cut U.S. deficit by $2.8 trillion over 10 years
item.description: A forecast from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office this week says Trump's tariffs could shave $2.8 trillion off the federal debt over the next decade, if they remain in place.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Feud erupts between President Trump and former adviser Elon Musk, CBO says Trump's tariffs could cut U.S. deficit by $2.8 trillion over 10 years, migrant detainees stage protest at facility in Miami.

item.title: Migrant detainees stage protest at ICE-run facility in Miami
item.description: Migrant detainees staged a protest at an ICE-run facility in Miami on Thursday. NPR reports on the deteriorating conditions at this immigration facility and others throughout Florida.

item.title: Navigating some of the thorny questions of estate planning
item.description: Over the next few decades, about $124 trillion will change hands in the U.S. through inheritance. Those transfers often run into problems. Plant Money navigates some thorny issues in estate planning.

item.title: Documentary challenges credit for Vietnam War photo of 'napalm girl'
item.description: Fifty-three years ago, the devastating impact of the Vietnam War was captured in a Pulitzer Prize-winning photo of the "napalm girl." A documentary raises questions about who took the photo.

item.title: Ecologist encourages people with yards to create little 'national parks'
item.description: Ecologist Doug Tallamy thinks a yard can become a little "national park." He's co-founder of Homegrown National Park, which encourages people to grow native plants in their yards.

item.title: Public feud erupts between President Trump and former adviser Elon Musk
item.description: A week ago, President Trump and Elon Musk were saying fond farewells as Musk left government. On Thursday, their disagreements over the GOP budget bill erupted into personal attacks.
